fr.sii.ogham.sms.sender.impl.cloudhopper.session

Class AlwaysNewSessionStrategy

  • java.lang.Object
    • fr.sii.ogham.sms.sender.impl.cloudhopper.session.BaseSessionHandlingStrategy
      • fr.sii.ogham.sms.sender.impl.cloudhopper.session.AlwaysNewSessionStrategy
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Cleanable, SessionHandlingStrategy

    public class AlwaysNewSessionStrategy
extends BaseSessionHandlingStrategy
    Simple management of SMPP session. For each message:
    1. Open a SMPP session
    2. Send the message
    3. Close the SMPP session

    Only one message can be sent in the same time.

    If an error is raised, the exception is thrown and the SMS is not sent.

    Author:
    Aur√©lien Baudet

      • getSession

        public com.cloudhopper.smpp.SmppSession getSession()
                                            throws SmppException
        Description copied from interface: SessionHandlingStrategy
        The client needs a session to be able to send the message.

        Either create a new session or use an existing one.

        Returns:
        the session
        Throws:
        SmppException - when the session can't be created (connection failure)

      • messageSent

        public void messageSent(Sms sms)

        Description copied from interface: SessionHandlingStrategy

        Parameters:

        Throws:

      • messageNotSent

        public void messageNotSent(Sms sms,
                           SmppException e)

        Throws:

      • messageProcessed

        public void messageProcessed(Sms sms)
        Description copied from interface: SessionHandlingStrategy
        Fired when a message has been processed i.e. either when message has been sent or when an error has been raised. This entrypoint may be useful to do some cleanup or to start background tasks for example.

        This method is always called after SessionHandlingStrategy.messageSent(Sms) and SessionHandlingStrategy.messageNotSent(Sms, SmppException).

        No exception should be thrown because this is used to end the process.

        Parameters:
        sms - the sent SMS

      • clean

        public void clean()
           throws CleanException
        Description copied from interface: Cleanable
        Clean all the opened resources before destruction.

        Generally, this method is called only once per instance. But there may exist some cases where the method is called several times.

        The implementation should ensure that if the method is called several times, the first time cleans the resources and the other calls doesn't do anything.

        Throws:
        CleanException - When cleanup has failed. This exception is likely to be ignored because if cleanup has failed, there is nothing more we can do. But this exception is important to track that cleanup has failed and to indicate it to the developer.
